questions.question: This is a great museum. Thanks for …………….. me here.
questions.description: We use bring for movements to the places where the speaker or hearer is.

questions.question: Put on your coat. I am ……………. you to the doctor.
questions.description: We use bring for movements to the places where the speaker or hearer is. Take is used for movements to other places.

questions.question: ………………. me your book for a minute, will you?
questions.description: Lend is like give. So lend me means give me.

questions.question: What happened to that camera you ……………… from me?
questions.description: Borrow is like take

questions.question: They live in a very …………… street.
questions.description: Wide is used to indicate the physical distance from one side of something to the other.

questions.question: He was a tall guy with …………. shoulders.
questions.description: Broad is used in some common expressions like broad shoulders and broad daylight.

questions.question: The movie was not very interesting but ……………. the acting was superb.
questions.description: We use ‘on the other hand’ to give the other side of a question.

questions.question: ‘I suppose the movie was very interesting.’ ‘…………….., it was a total waste of time.’
questions.description: On the contrary is used to contradict – to say that what has just been said is not true or correct.

questions.question: So far 100 people ……………… in the riots.
questions.description: Died is the past participle of die. Dead is an adjective.

questions.question: Nobody helped me ………………. him.
questions.description: Except means other than.

questions.question: ………………… his support, I would have failed.
questions.description: Without and but for are possible here.

questions.question: This jacket does not …………… me. Have you got a smaller size?
questions.description: Fit refers to size and shape.

questions.question: Don’t ………….. in bed all day.
questions.description: To lie is to be down or become horizontal.

questions.question: Susie was supposed to go to the party, but she was ill so Joe went ...................... her.
questions.description: If Joe went instead of Susie, that means he replaced her. If he went without Susie, that means he went alone. Susie didn't accompany him.

questions.question: ………….. expensive holidays could be the most interesting.
questions.description: The least can be used before adjectives in the same way as ‘the most’.

questions.question: He …………….. to me when he said he loved me.
questions.description: Lied is the past participle of lie.

questions.question: She didn’t let me …………… what she was writing.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: After questioning they were …………. home.
questions.description: Let is not normally used in passive forms.

questions.question: My parents had …………….
questions.description: When 'life' refers to the whole of a person’s life, it is normally countable and is used with articles.

questions.question: I …………….. you and your husband.
questions.description: Very much cannot go between like and its object.

questions.question: I waited ………………… but he didn’t arrive.
questions.description: Long is mainly used in questions and negatives. In affirmative clauses, we use for a long time.

questions.question: …………….. carefully – it is moving.
questions.description: No preposition is used when there is no object after look.

questions.question: Paper is made ………… wood.
questions.description: When a material is changed into a totally different form to make something, we use make from.

questions.question: You …………… work tomorrow if you don’t want to.
questions.description: Needn’t and don’t have to mean the same.
